definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

sentences.english: I am curious and ask some tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 我的好奇心會促使我提出一些刁鑽的問題。

sentences.english: Do your own research and ask them tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 做好你自己的研究，問他們一些刁鑽的問題。

sentences.english: If he gives me one of his tricky slow balls, I'll knock it for six.
sentences.chinese: 刁鑽古怪的慢球，我就給他來個一擊得最高分。

sentences.english: He was just trying to stop a ball that squirmed around.
sentences.chinese: 他只是盡力去阻擋那記刁鑽的射門罷了。

sentences.english: Semester selected foreign teacher of photography classes, operating small, very tricky.
sentences.chinese: 這個學期選了外教的攝影課，作業不多，卻很刁鑽。

sentences.english: The show's host was known for asking tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 該節目主持人以提問刁鑽古怪問題而聞名。

definition: by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
